May 26, 1966
MEMO TO: STAFF CREDIT CARD HOLDERS
FROM: HAROLD HILL
Because of the very complex problems that vould arise if we attempted
to cancel all so-called company account" credit cards and require
each person to make his own arrangements for such cards, Mr. Harley
has decided that we can continue to use the cards now in our possession
provided each of us signs a release form (attached). Also, each
individual will hereafter be required to pay the yearly "membership
fee," assessed by certain credit card companies, which in the past
has often been paid by the NAEB. As indicated earlier, credit cards
for transportation (Air Travel and rental car) will continue as
company account cards.
Please sign the attached form and return it to the accounting office.
HEH:so
